question:
You forgot an item of clothing at the hotel where you stayed recently. Write a letter to the hotel manager and include the following:

– When did you stay and in what room?
– Describe the item you left behind.
– What would you like the manager to do about it?
text: I am writing to bring to your notice,  the belongings that we have potentially missed grabbing, while checking out of your hotel at 312 Bourke street. For your records and reference, My husband and I booked the room  for, June 20-June 30 of this month. Our room was situated on level 5, and the room number was 501.

I am ,therefore, putting a description and specifications of the items in order to, make the task easier for you: There are two bags. The first bag is a labelled Zara signature bag, with 2 pairs of jeans and 1 pink scarf. The second bad is a Louis Vitton bag that contains the signature blue and white stripe clutch bag in it. Moreover, Both the bags should have receipts with my name (Sara Hamilton) on them.

Now that you have the details of the same, I would request if you could hand these over to, Mr Jack paul (one of our friends) who will be picking it up anytime and day, this week. Additionally, do let me know in case you require any further details along with, anything you need the person to bring as an identification.
We thank you for providing us with a wonderful stay, meanwhile, our special gratitude for this help.
Looking forward to hearing from you!

error_list.error_des: It appears that you have an unnecessary comma before the dependent clause marker while. Consider removing the comma.
